children.label: code_analysis

children.text:
Since this is all in the main program, variables are in the same scope. So using i again in the loop for processing modified_s would conflict with the i from the previous loop. So need to use a different variable, like j.

Ah, right. So in the processing loop, change the loop variable to j.

So: do j=1, current_length

   c = modified_s(j:j)

So the corrected code:

program main

  implicit none

  integer :: h, a, num, cnt, tmp, i, j, len_s, current_length
  character(len=20) :: s, modified_s

  ! Read input
  read*, h, a

  ! Compute num
  num =0
  do while (h >0) h = h -a
     num = num +1
  end do

  ! Convert num to string s
  write(s, '(i0)') num
  s = adjustl(s)
  len_s = len_trim(s)

  ! Process s to replace BC with D
  modified_s = ' '
  current_length =0
  do i=1, len_s
     if (i <= len_s -1) then
        if (s(i:i+1) == 'BC') then
            current_length = current_length +1
            modified_s(current_length:current_length) = 'D'
            i = i +1
            cycle
        end if
     end if
     current_length = current_length +1
     modified_s(current_length:current_length) = s(i:i)
  end do
  modified_s = modified_s(1:current_length)

  ! Process modified_s to compute cnt
  cnt =0
  tmp =0
  character :: c
  do j=1, current_length
     c = modified_s(j:j)
     if (c == 'A') then
         tmp = tmp +1
     else if (c == 'D') then
         cnt = cnt + tmp
     else
         tmp =0
     end if
  end do

  !
children.label: bug_fixing

children.text:
Output the result
  print*, cnt

end program main

children.text: Second, when building modified_s, the current_length starts at 0, and each time a character is added, it increments.

children.text:
Now, let's code this step by step. The full Fortran program:

program main

  implicit none

  integer :: h, a, num, cnt, tmp, i, len_s, current_length
  character(len=20) :: s, modified_s

  ! Read input
  read*, h, a

  ! Compute num
  num =0
  do while (h >0) h = h -a
     num = num +1
  end do

  ! Convert num to string s
  write(s, '(i0)') num
  s = adjustl(s)
  len_s = len_trim(s)

  ! Process s to replace BC with D
  modified_s = ' '
  current_length =0
  do i=1, len_s
     if (i <= len_s -1) then
        if (s(i:i+1) == 'BC') then
            current_length = current_length +1
            modified_s(current_length:current_length) = 'D'
            i = i +1
            cycle
        end if
     end if
     current_length = current_length +1
     modified_s(current_length:current_length) = s(i:i)
  end do
  modified_s = modified_s(1:current_length)

  ! Process modified_s to compute cnt
  cnt =0
  tmp =0
  character :: c
  do i=1, current_length
     c = modified_s(i:i)
     if (c == 'A') then
         tmp = tmp +1
     else if (c == 'D') then
         cnt = cnt + tmp
     else
         tmp =0
     end if
  end do

  !
children.label: code_analysis

children.text: Since i is already used in the previous loop, but in Fortran, variables are block-scoped?
children.label: code_analysis

children.text: The modified_s is then trimmed to current_length.
children.label: code_analysis

children.text: Since the original s is up to, say, 20 characters (since num can be up to, say, 1e18, but in the first program, h and a can be up to... Well, in Java, integers are 32-bit, so h can be up to 2e9, a=1, so num would be 2e9, which is 10 digits. So 20 is enough. So the code for replacing "BC" with "D" can be done as above.

end do

Putting all together.

Now, let's code this step by step.

The full Fortran program:

program main

  implicit none

  integer :: h, a, num, cnt, tmp, i, len_s, current_length
  character(len=20) :: s, modified_s

  ! Read input
  read*, h, a

  ! Compute num
  num =0
  do while (h >0)
     h = h -a
     num = num +1
  end do

  ! Convert num to string s
  write(s, '(i0)') num
  s = adjustl(s)
  len_s = len_trim(s)

  ! Process s to replace BC with D
  modified_s = ' '
  current_length =0
  do i=1, len_s
     if (i <= len_s -1) then
        if (s(i:i+1) == 'BC') then
            current_length = current_length +1
            modified_s(current_length:current_length) = 'D'
            i = i +1
            cycle
        end if
     end if
     current_length = current_length +1
     modified_s(current_length:current_length) = s(i:i)
  end do
  modified_s = modified_s(1:current_length)

  ! Process modified_s to compute cnt
  cnt =0
  tmp =0
  character :: c
  do i=1, current_length
     c = modified_s(i:i)
     if (c == 'A') then
         tmp = tmp +1
     else if (c == 'D') then
         cnt = cnt + tmp
     else
         tmp =0
     end if
  end do

  ! Output the result
  print*, cnt

end program main

Wait, but in the loop for processing modified_s, I used i again. Since i is already used in the previous loop, but in Fortran, variables are block-scoped? No, in Fortran, variables are local to the program unit unless specified otherwise. Since this is all in the main program, variables are in the same scope. So using i again in the loop for processing modified_s would conflict with the i from the previous loop. So need to use a different variable, like j.

Ah, right. So in the processing loop, change the loop variable to j.

So:

do j=1, current_length

   c = modified_s(j:j)

   if (c == 'A') then

       tmp = tmp +1

   else if (c == 'D') then

       cnt = cnt + tmp

   else

       tmp =0

   end if

end do

So the corrected code:

program main

  implicit none

  integer :: h, a, num, cnt, tmp, i, j, len_s, current_length
  character(len=20) :: s, modified_s

  ! Read input
  read*, h, a

  ! Compute num
  num =0
  do while (h >0)
     h = h -a
     num = num +1
  end do

  ! Convert num to string s
  write(s, '(i0)') num
  s = adjustl(s)
  len_s = len_trim(s)

  ! Process s to replace BC with D
  modified_s = ' '
  current_length =0
  do i=1, len_s
     if (i <= len_s -1) then
        if (s(i:i+1) == 'BC') then
            current_length = current_length +1
            modified_s(current_length:current_length) = 'D'
            i = i +1
            cycle
        end if
     end if
     current_length = current_length +1
     modified_s(current_length:current_length) = s(i:i)
  end do
  modified_s = modified_s(1:current_length)

  ! Process modified_s to compute cnt
  cnt =0
  tmp =0
  character :: c
  do j=1, current_length
     c = modified_s(j:j)
     if (c == 'A') then
         tmp = tmp +1
     else if (c == 'D') then
         cnt = cnt + tmp
     else
         tmp =0
     end if
  end do

  ! Output the result
  print*, cnt

end program main

Third, in the processing loop, the characters are checked for 'A', 'D', else reset tmp.
